# Language Codes Repository

## Purpose
This repository contains a table of language codes, including English names, native names, subtags, and URLs to country flags. The table aims to provide an easily accessible reference for language identification codes aligned with IETF standards.

## Table of Contents

- [Purpose](#purpose)  
- [Standards](#standards)

- [Examples of Language Code Usage in Programming](#examples-of-language-code-usage-in-programming)  
   - [HTML](#html)  
   - [JavaScript](#javascript)  
   - [Python](#python)  
   - [Java](#java)  
   - [.NET](#net)

- [Licensing](#licensing)  
- [Reporting Issues](#reporting-issues)  
- [Contributing](#contributing)  
- [How to Citation](#citation)  
- [Utilization of AI in This Project](#utilization-of-ai-in-this-project)  
- [References](#references)  
- [Final Notes](#final-notes)  
- [Author](#author)  
- [Contact](#contact)

## Standards
The language codes and tags conform to the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) standards, specifically those outlined in BCP 47 and RFC 4646.

## Usage of Language Codes
Language codes are used to identify the language of content in various applications across computing and internet communications, enhancing global interoperability.

## Release Notes

### 2025-01-09 - Updates - tag v1.0.0

#### Bugfix

[Issue #2](https://github.com/dadosnapratica/language-code-table/issues/2) Solved

- **Invalid URL Handling:** Improved to ensure default images are used when URLs are non-valid.

- **Error Handling:** Robust error management and default image fallback systems are in place for improved reliability.

#### Improvements

- **Direct DataFrame Updates:** Ensured modifications within loops directly affect the main DataFrame.

- **Enhanced Logging:** Detailed feedback is now provided for each step, especially around URL handling.

#### New Utility Script: `get_base64_country_flag.py`

We are pleased to announce the addition of a new utility script to our project, `get_base64_country_flag.py`. This script enhances our application's ability to handle country flag images by fetching them from URLs and converting them into a Base64 format. This is particularly useful for maintaining image data within databases or embedding directly in HTML or CSS without external file dependencies.

##### Key Features:

- **Fetch and Convert:** The script can fetch flag images from specified URLs and convert them into a Base64 encoded string, ensuring compatibility across various platforms that do not support external image hosting.

- **Error Handling:** It includes robust error handling to manage common issues like broken links or inaccessible servers, substituting a default flag image if the original cannot be fetched.

- **Integration:** Designed to seamlessly integrate with existing modules, it can be used as a standalone tool or as part of larger data processing workflows.

This utility script simplifies the management of image resources, making our application more reliable and versatile in handling visual data.

For more detailed information, refer to the full [Release Notes Document](RELEASE_NOTES.md).

|Uzbekistan                  |Uzbek              |Usbeque            |Uzbek/Ўзбек                  |uz    |https://flagcdn.com/16x12/uz.png                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

|Senegal                     |Wolof              |Wolof              |Wolof                        |wo    |https://flagcdn.com/16x12/sn.png                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|South Africa                |Xhosa              |Xhosa              |isiXhosa                     |xh    |https://flagcdn.com/16x12/za.png                                                                          |                                                    |
|Nigeria                     |Yoruba             |Iorubá             |Yoruba                       |yo    |https://flagcdn.com/16x12/ng.png                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|China                       |Chinese            |Chinês             |中文                           |zh    |https://flagcdn.com/16x12/cn.png                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|South Africa                |Zulu               |Zulu               |isiZulu                      |zu    |https://flagcdn.com/16x12/za.png                                                                          |                                                    |


### DataFrame Column Descriptions

- **language_country_name**: Name of the country associated with the language. This column was kept as loaded from the CSV file without the need for specific cleaning or validation.

- **english_name**: Name of the language in English. This column was also maintained as loaded, without any additional adjustments.

- **portuguese_br_name**: Name of the language in Brazilian Portuguese. Like the previous ones, this column did not require cleaning or validation.

- **native_name**: Native name of the language, as it is called locally. No cleaning or validation rules were applied to this column.

- **subtag**: Subtag of the language, usually a shortening or code that uniquely identifies the language. This column was kept unchanged.

- **country_flag_url**: URL for the country flag associated with the language. Validation of this column was carried out to ensure the URLs are valid. Invalid URLs were replaced with `None`. A validation process using the `validators.url` function was applied to check each URL, and invalid ones were marked and logged.

- **country_flag_base64**: Base64 representation of the country flag. This column was created by converting the flag images obtained from valid URLs into Base64 strings. In the event of a failure to obtain the flag image, a generic Base64 encoded image was used as a substitute. The `fetch_and_convert_image` function was used to fetch and convert the image, and in case of an error in the fetching process, the default image ('./data/generic_flag.png') was used.

### Cleaning and Validation Rules

1. **URL Validation**: Each URL in the `country_flag_url` column was checked. If a URL was not valid, its value in the column was changed to `None`.

2. **Image Conversion**: The flag images were downloaded from valid URLs and converted to Base64 format. In cases of failures in obtaining the images, a standard image was used.

3. **Logging Invalid URLs**: During the validation process, invalid URLs were logged for review.

These steps ensure that the data are correct and usable for future analyses, in addition to guaranteeing that there will be no errors in using the image URLs.


## Direct Links to Data and Schema

To access the language code tables and related schema, use the links below:

- **CSV Format Table**: [Download CSV Table](https://github.com/dadosnapratica/language-code-table/blob/main/data/dadosnapratica_language_code.csv) or use direct in your program with http request to https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dadosnapratica/language-code-table/refs/heads/main/data/dadosnapratica_language_code.csv
- **JSON Format Table**: [Download JSON Table](https://github.com/dadosnapratica/language-code-table/blob/main/data/dadosnapratica_language_code.json) or use direct in your program with http request to https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dadosnapratica/language-code-table/refs/heads/main/data/dadosnapratica_language_code.json

- **JSON Schema**: [Download JSON Schema](https://github.com/dadosnapratica/language-code-table/blob/main/data/dadosnapratica_language_code_schema.jsona) or use direct in your program with http request to https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dadosnapratica/language-code-table/refs/heads/main/data/dadosnapratica_language_code_schema.json


## Examples of Language Code Usage in Programming
### HTML
```html
<html lang="en">
```
### Javascript
```javascript
const userLanguage = navigator.language;
alert('Your language is: ' + userLanguage);
```
### Python
```python
import locale
current_locale = locale.getdefaultlocale()
print("Current locale is:", current_locale)
```
### Java
```java
import java.util.Locale;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Locale locale = new Locale("fr", "FR");
        System.out.println("Language: " + locale.getLanguage());
        System.out.println("Country: " + locale.getCountry());
    }
}
```

### .NET
```dotnet
using System.Globalization;
using System.Threading;

class Program {
    static void Main() {
        CultureInfo cultureInfo = new CultureInfo("es-ES");
        Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture = cultureInfo;
        Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture = cultureInfo;
        
        Console.WriteLine("Current Culture: " + CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.Name);
    }
}
```
* .Net locale use (C# CultureInfo) name in format LanguageCode2[-Country/RegionCode2]. Please refer to link https://www.venea.net/web/culture-code to get .NET Culture related codes.


### Use in Google Speech API
```python
from google.cloud import translate

def translate_text(text="Hello, world!", target="fr"):
    client = translate.TranslationServiceClient()
    response = client.translate_text(
        contents=[text],
        target_language_code=target,
        parent="projects/your-project-id"
    )
    for translation in response.translations:
        print("Translated text: ", translation.translated_text)

translate_text()
```

If you want to see the prompt I used, see it at, share it:
[ChatGPT Prompt - Extract Language Code Tables](https://chatgpt.com/share/677f7883-9630-800d-958d-570e11be7b08)

## References

-   [Wikipedia IETF Language Tags Overview](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) - An overview of IETF language tags, their purpose, structure, and usage.
-   [RFC BCP 47: Tags for Identifying Languages](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) - Best Current Practices for the tags used to identify languages.
-   [RFC 4646: Tags for Identifying Languages](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4646) - Details on the structure and rules for creating language tags for internet applications.
-   [Language Tags and Codes Explained by W3C](https://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/) - How to construct language tags and their application in HTML and XML.
-   [Comprehensive List of Culture Codes](https://www.venea.net/web/culture-code) - A detailed list of culture names, ISO codes, Windows codes, and IETF language tags. Special usingn with .NET CultureInfo related langueage codes.
